cleaned_content: last reviewed in 2023 this is a revised review in apr 2025 still 2 it has past its best the game is very much monetise now every now and then very often some events will pop out and everything is about and the prizes given are definitely not worth the value you paid in the good old days paid event will normally give quite good iv pokemon not anymore these days you will get 2 lousy iv pokemon for paid event i stopped buying and you should too
content: last reviewed in 2023. This is a revised review in Apr 2025. Still 2*. It has past its best... the game is very much monetise now. Every now and then (very often), some events will pop out, and everything is about $. And the prizes given are definitely not worth the value you paid. cleaned_content: i love pokémon have played go since launch first played on s8 then s20 ultra since 2020 go drains battery faster now than ever on my old phone if you play as you go about your day expect 2 hours before your phone dies the avatars were always bad but are way worse now that they removed separate male female models the new genderless ones look uncanny clothing hair constantly clip through the avatar go is more expensive yet has less free content than ever i can no longer recommend
content: I love Pokémon & have played GO since launch. First played on S8, then S20 Ultra since 2020. GO drains battery faster now than ever on my old phone. If you play as you go about your day, expect ~2 hours before your phone dies. The avatars were always bad but are way worse now that they removed separate male & female models. The new genderless ones look uncanny. Clothing & hair constantly clip through the avatar. GO is more expensive yet has less free content than ever. I can no longer recommend.

Collecting is fun enough I suppose and the game looks good enough but for something with this big of a budget, you would think they'd make a good game

cleaned_content: words of warning cs is not very helpful app is very p2w you can be banned for cheating even if you aren t there have been connection and location issues since 2016 gl with that ar only works on certain phones check if you have arcore or google play services for ar if you don t have either attempt to install both if your device is incompatible to both no ar photography or gameplay for you i m afraid there are lists that say what devices are compatible but they have false data
content: Words of Warning: CS is not very helpful. App is very P2W. You can be banned for cheating even if you aren't. There have been connection and location issues since 2016. GL with that. AR !!!ONLY!!! works on certain phones. Check if you have ARCore or Google Play Services for AR. If you don't have either, attempt to install both. If your device is incompatible to both no AR photography or gameplay for you I'm afraid. There are lists that say what devices are compatible but they have false data.

And two, some features aren't well explained and involve far too much messing around to try to figure them out.

cleaned_content: if you are a fan of pokemon then you will love this game the challenges and tasks it gives are what makes this game fun and challenging getting the chance to collect is great some pokemon are behind a paywall so there is that however most times they do give it out for free as a task reward the downside is that there are times when bugs in the game or issues destroy the experience example is when my remote raid pass was wasted when the game froze crashed those passes are not cheap
content: If you are a fan of Pokemon, then you will love this game. The challenges and tasks it gives are what makes this game fun and challenging. Getting the chance to collect is great. The downside is that there are times when bugs in the game or issues destroy the experience. Example is when my remote raid pass was wasted when the game froze/crashed. Those passes are not cheap.

content: Been playing this game on/off since launch but the last few weeks have been especially buggy. Similar freeze with trainers, except it also counts as a loss to close the app.

cleaned_content: pokemon go is about capturing fictional creatures that you can use to fight against enemies you can heal or turn the creatures into orbs you can also hatch creatures from eggs there s gyms which you can fight for and put pokemon in them as well as poke stops that you can get things from also customize characters all of these things are great in quality other than the occasional loading process i ve had this game for several years and i still love it very dearly
content: Pokemon Go is about capturing fictional creatures that you can use to fight against enemies. You can heal or turn the creatures into orbs. You can also hatch creatures from eggs. There's 'gyms' which you can fight for and put pokemon in them. As well as poke stops that you can get things from. (Also customize characters) All of these things are great in quality, other than the occasional loading process. I've had this game for several years and I still love it very dearly.

cleaned_content: after a while it gets very repetitive and boring i used to love go but it s becoming a chore even with the new dynamax there isn t an obvious method to send feedback barely offer any f2p content anymore most all event research is paid events end at an odd hour 8pm most of the time instead of the end of the day i would understand if it was based on another time zone but it s based on local time i m more focused on eating dinner at that hour not making sure my research is done
content: After a while, it gets VERY repetitive and boring. I used to love Go, but it's becoming a chore. Even with the new Dynamax. There isn't an obvious method to send feedback. Barely offer any F2P content anymore; most all event research is paid. Events end at an odd hour(8pm MOST of the time) instead of the end of the day. I would understand if it was based on another time zone but it's based on LOCAL TIME. I'm more focused on eating dinner at that hour, not making sure my research is done.

The search for these activities also promotes leaving your teammates.

cleaned_content: the direction niantic is taking this game is worrisome and not sustainable the gmax event was a joke no matchmaking the max spots changed from the first day which ruined planning the flee rate is roughly the same if not more than legendary raids and everyone pretty much had to start from scratch the years of investment into existing pokemon are completely useless with dynamax gigantamax not to mention on top of incredible difficulty it s only live for 2 days so unlikely to get good ivs
content: The direction niantic is taking this game is worrisome and not sustainable. The GMax event was a joke. No matchmaking, the max spots changed from the first day which ruined planning, the flee rate is roughly the same if not more than legendary raids, and everyone pretty much had to start from scratch. The years of investment into existing pokemon are completely useless with dynamax/gigantamax. Not to mention, on top of incredible difficulty, it's only live for 2 days, so unlikely to get good IVs

Stop trying to push the newest starters. Nobody likes them.

content: To come back on a previous review: 1- The game is training AI with people location. AI will know where you live, where you and what you is the "patern"/way of life. If the game wasn't built on the back of an enormously popular IP it'd already be dead.

cleaned_content: this game is quite good but a problem is the spending like with most games nowadays you have to pay to win only difference with pokémon go is you can earn the coins from battles only problem with that though is it s maxed out at 50 coins per day i think this should be increased to also you have to spend 200 coins for only 50 spaces for the poke storage and items which isn t really fair as you basically have to be in gyms for 4 days to be able to only get 50 spaces and that s just for 1
content: This game is quite good, but a problem is the spending. Like with most games nowadays you have to "pay to win". Only difference with Pokémon Go is you can earn the coins from battles, only problem with that though is it's maxed out at 50 coins per day. I think this should be increased to. Also you have to spend 200 coins for ONLY 50 spaces for the poke storage and items, which isn't really fair. As you basically have to be in gyms for 4 days to be able to only get 50 spaces and that's just for 1

content: I played originally back in 2016, but fell away from the game in 2017. Just a couple of months ago, March 2025, I decided to try it again to encourage me to walk more as I recovered from an injury. How far the game has come! content: Fun game but needs work. First, for 5 dollars for 3 freaking remote raid passes, that feels like a huge scam. Secondly, perhaps bump the numbers up on catch chances for raid pokemon. Especially since most people are using remote raid passes in order to do the raid. LastlyI think needs changing is more backpack space for the money you actually pay and, most importantly, add a trade feature for Candy as well. Everyone I know has stopped playing cause of all this. Other than that, it's pretty good.

cleaned_content: mid average meh are words i d used to describe this game it ll never blow your socks off it s carried entirely by the love for pokémon but niantic has no idea what they re doing whatsoever everything they put out is okay at best and usually ruined by their greed a new feature means something is usually being nerfed and you re never truly getting anywhere it never crosses that threshold of being fun and you ll wind up waiting years before realizing it ll never come
content: "Mid", "average", "meh" are words I'd used to describe this game, it'll never blow your socks off. It's carried entirely by the love for Pokémon but Niantic has no idea what they're doing whatsoever. Everything they put out is "okay" at best and usually ruined by their greed. A new feature means something is usually being nerfed and you're never truly getting anywhere. It never crosses that threshold of being "fun" and you'll wind up waiting years before realizing it'll never come.

cleaned_content: this game s idea of stalling out masterwork research is to make it so other trainers have to contribute to your advancement via competing directly against them to be 1st place hoping they don t sit on one day left to best friends when you need 20 of them and finally to lucky trade with five of those friends you most likely have no way of communicating with in order to achieve this there is absolutely no way i would buy or recommend masterwork tickets after this let alone spend more money
content: This game's idea of stalling out masterwork research is to make it so other trainers have to contribute to your advancement via competing directly against them to be 1st place, hoping they don't sit on one day left to best friends when you need 20 of them, and finally to lucky trade with five of those friends you most likely have no way of communicating with in order to achieve this. There is absolutely no way I would buy (or recommend) masterwork tickets after this, let alone spend more money.

content: I downloaded this game for my son but it's poorly developed and maintained. After a while it became clear to me that the point of this game is to convert micro transactions, not produce enjoyable gameplay. The latest updates brought in horrendous, genderless avatars (he literally cried when he saw his character) and a ton of UI/UX bugs. It is super laggy and keeps freezing. It even takes 2-3 attempts just to log in. It's a shame because he loves walking around our neighborhood catching Pokemon.

content: Love this game so much, I have to recommend it. I love collecting my favorite mons and powering them up to their full potential, hunting shinies and high IVs, and getting epic raid bosses and legendaries. That said, there are some things that need improvement. The player models are pretty goofy and not very customizable, and the trading system feels pretty tedious and annoying sometimes. Overall still a 10/10, one of the best pokemon games out there, and actually got me to touch grass

content: I had a love and hate relation with this game. It was fun, and made me to walk more (essential for my health). But it had bugs, used an immense amount of battery and data, and devs got increasingly greedy (prices going up in the shop, no more free revives or potions, events cost money etc). Now with the "AR not supported on your phone", I guess it's the end of a 7-year journey. I have a flagship phone (Nokia xr20, android 13) and I do not plan to upgrade. Bye and thanks for all!

content: Update about a year later: nothing from my previous review has changed. The game was fun when it came out but now it is predatory. Everything rolled out during the pandemic has slowly been rolled back and then some. They raised the prices for remote raids so unless you can physically go to areas (driving won't work as there are speed limiters), you cannot "Catch 'Em All!" This game seems to have diminishing returns the more you play, and as a lifelong Pokémon fan it is truly disappointing.

cleaned_content: raids in pokémon go are a mess right now raid bosses are spamming charged moves and our pokémon are getting one shotted constantly dodging does nothing and our teams are going down like flies making it impossible to keep up without spending money to revive earning raid passes is way too hard and it s clear niantic is prioritizing greed over player enjoyment shadow raids are even worse tokens to subdue the shadow bosses don t work properly and once again our pokémon are dropping
content: Raids in Pokémon GO are a mess right now! Raid bosses are spamming charged moves, and our Pokémon are getting one-shotted constantly. Dodging does nothing, and our teams are going down like flies, making it impossible to keep up without spending money to revive. Earning raid passes is way too hard, and it's clear Niantic is prioritizing greed over player enjoyment. Shadow Raids are even worse—tokens to subdue the Shadow bosses don’t work properly, and once again, our Pokémon are dropping.

Niantic, if you care about what you've made, please set it back to what it was. And make this new "inclusion model" an option when changing appearances.

cleaned_content: i d like to see these things added to the game 1 have a way to sort friend s gifts by location 2 gyms that allow caught novelty pokémon like legendary or mythical 3 allow a single person to start a raid battle right away instead of having to wait for the count down 4 allow trading between far away locations either by placing a pokémon in a trade bin at a gym with acceptable trade pokémon marked or by 2 friend s meeting at different gyms and doing a live trade
content: I'd like to see these things added to the game - 1) Have a way to "sort friend's gifts" by location. 2) Gyms that allow caught novelty Pokémon (like Legendary or Mythical) 3) Allow a single person to start a Raid Battle right away, instead of having to wait for the "count down" 4) Allow trading between far away locations (either by placing a Pokémon in a trade bin at a Gym with acceptable trade Pokémon marked, or by 2 friend's meeting at different Gyms and doing a "live" trade).

cleaned_content: this game is not the same as 2016 pokemon go nor is it the same as the 2020 2022 beast that it was becoming for a time this game is now just a glorified gotcha cash grab the recent changes being made between avatar changes shop price gouging and the heavy move towards paid ticketed events that used to come free seem to infer that there is an active development team working on the game and yet they seem to do things that discouraged their already loyal fan base pray for the future of pogo
content: This game is not the same as 2016 pokemon go. Nor is it the same as the 2020-2022 beast that it was becoming for a time. This game is now just a glorified gotcha cash grab. The recent changes being made-between avatar changes, shop price gouging and the heavy move towards paid ticketed events that used to come free- seem to infer that there is an active development team working on the game, and yet, they seem to do things that discouraged their already loyal fan base. Pray for the future of PoGo

cleaned_content: was a great game for a long time new update is unplayable for pvp almost every match now has at least one brief match losing instance of lag whether you re on wi fi 5g data with or without graphic smoothing refresh rate setting emptying cache data doesn t matter stops registering your fast attacks your taps for charge moves for just a second but it s enough to lose you very winnable battles and drive you nuts not to mention the full freezes mid match
content: Was a great game for a long time. New update is *unplayable* for PvP. Almost every match now has at least one brief, match-losing instance of lag whether you're on wi-fi, 5G data, with or without graphic smoothing, refresh rate setting, emptying cache data, doesn't matter. Stops registering your fast attacks, your taps for charge moves, for just a second, but it's enough to lose you very winnable battles and drive you nuts. Not to mention the full freezes mid-match.

cleaned_content: some skill is involved but pvp is by far a rock paper scissors game however you are paired with opponents such that you will always be close to a 50 win ratio if you win too many matches the game will pair you up with opponents that hard counter your team matchmaking is highly manipulated by the game s algorithm people tank to cheat the matchmaking algorithm and hard counter opponents frame drops and lag are also pervasive go battle league pvp is anything but competitive and fair
content: Some skill is involved but PVP is by far a rock paper scissors game. However- You are paired with opponents such that you will always be close to a 50% win ratio. If you win too many matches, the game will pair you up with opponents that hard counter your team. Matchmaking is highly manipulated by the game's algorithm. People TANK to cheat the matchmaking algorithm and hard counter opponents. Frame drops and lag are also pervasive. Go Battle League PVP is anything but competitive and fair.

cleaned_content: an extremely poorly designed game full of errors and annoying and unfair mechanics where skill plays almost no real role in gameplay sometimes bugs and lag make it almost unplayable even on high end devices it is also full of unskippable animations that only waste time absurd algorithms and probabilities it s shameful that the pokemon company associates itself with a lousy pay to win sad excuse for a game such as this even as a free app not worth it s price so much to improve
content: An extremely poorly designed game, full of errors, and annoying and unfair mechanics, where skill plays almost no real role in gameplay. Sometimes bugs and lag make it almost unplayable, even on high end devices. It is also full of unskippable animations that only waste time, absurd algorithms and probabilities. cleaned_content: voting on things going on within the ap should be done within the app not on twitter the ar features in the game are practically unusable yet required for certain actions in the game for one it cant detect a flat surface to save it s own life two the game starts to overheat my device when i use such features not to mention the lag spikes it causes my main suggestion is to allow the quick treat feature to access the features restricted to ar avatars all look like trash now
content: Voting on things going on within the ap should be done within the app. Not on twitter. The AR features in the game are practically unusable yet required for certain actions in the game. For one, it cant detect a flat surface to save it's own life, two the game starts to overheat my device when I use such features not to mention the lag spikes it causes. My main suggestion is to allow the "quick treat" feature to access the features restricted to AR. Avatars all look like trash now.

content: It's not completely terrible, it's nice to play while travelling back and forth or if you have ten minutes to kill here or there. cleaned_content: i know i m rating 3 stars but if i could the overall experience from august to october 2024 would range from about 1 to 3 stars the game itself isn t bad nor the best but the glitches the app constantly shutting down on me at random intervals the fact that there s less ftp content all these things was just enough to make me stop playing and uninstall maybe once they fix the glitches and make the game work better i might come back but for now i m done and can t play this game
content: I know I'm rating 3 stars, but if I could, the overall experience from August to October 2024 would range from about 1 to 3 stars. The game itself isn't bad nor the best... but the glitches, the app constantly shutting down on me at random intervals, the fact that there's less FTP content... All these things was just enough to make me stop playing and uninstall. Maybe once they fix the glitches and make the game work better, I might come back. But for now, I'm done and can't play this game!

cleaned_content: it s a pokémon tracking game but has no method of tracking pokémon you either have to sit at lure hubs pay to upkeep which just attract pidgeys and rattatas or you wander around blindly hoping something on the nearby list is in the direction you re walking gyms yeah just rapidly tap your screen to win that s fun i hope you have a snorlax or vaporeon because those are the only pokémon that will win due to the unbalanced cp system that hides the actual stats of pokémon overhyped dissappointment
content: It's a Pokémon tracking game but has no method of tracking Pokémon. You either have to sit at lure hubs (pay $$$ to upkeep) which just attract Pidgeys and Rattatas, or you wander around blindly hoping something on the Nearby list is in the direction you're walking. Gyms? Yeah just rapidly tap your screen to win, that's fun. I hope you have a Snorlax or Vaporeon because those are the only Pokémon that will win due to the unbalanced CP system that hides the actual stats of Pokémon. Overhyped dissappointment.

content: I have fun playing this game as a means of motivation for getting outdoors and catching cute and cool Pokemon, but it seems as though every new major update lessens quality of life, and the developers could care less about their playerbase. If you're alright with not being heard as a community and can live with continuous downgrades, then give the game a go! Be prepared to "learn to live with it," though, almost every time they push something new.

cleaned_content: mixed feelings pvp is boring a broken mess frame drops and lag galore the events are repetitive and behind a paywall for the good stuff especially recently one of the few lifelines for f2p players the remote raid passes are overpriced also pretty unfriendly for small communities as well with the addition of max battles this is even worse tons of bugs w every new update the concept itself is fun but it s being kept alive by the ip nostalgia hardcore fans
content: Mixed feelings. PvP is boring & a broken mess. Frame drops and lag galore. The events are repetitive, and behind a paywall, for the good stuff. Especially recently. One of the few lifelines for f2p players, the remote raid passes are overpriced. Also, pretty unfriendly for small communities, as well. With the addition of Max Battles, this is even worse. Tons of bugs, w/ every new update. The concept itself is fun, but it's being kept alive by the IP, nostalgia, & hardcore fans.

cleaned_content: the avatar update niantic posted on social media now your avatars can look more like you and here is what they mean the male model is the only player model proportions are unnaturally elongated clipping was introduced you may add breasts to your male presenting avatar of the 7 faces only the 1st is feminine the only variety in the other 6 are side view changes of the 25 disorganized skin colors 9 are deathly pale 4 are med gray 5 are brown gray and 5 are dark brown gray
content: The avatar update. Niantic posted on social media, "Now your avatars can look more like you!" And here is what they mean: The male model is the only player model. Proportions are unnaturally elongated. Clipping was introduced. You may add breasts to your male-presenting avatar. Of the 7 faces, only the 1st is feminine. The only variety in the other 6 are side-view changes. Of the 25 disorganized skin colors, 9 are deathly pale, 4 are med-gray, 5 are brown-gray, and 5 are dark brown-gray.

cleaned_content: this game is a chore that wants to nickle and dime you for every hour i spend catching pokemon i feel like i spend 2x that managing inventory figuring out what s worth keeping you can buy more pack space so you can let the clutter build longer but eventually you re managing inventory want to hatch all those eggs want to participate in events every couple of weeks just buy a real pokemon if that s your thing or gameify walking with something less tedious
content: This game is a chore that wants to nickle and dime you. For every hour I spend catching Pokemon, I feel like I spend 2x that managing inventory & figuring out what's worth keeping. You can buy more pack space so you can let the clutter build longer, but eventually you're managing inventory. Want to hatch all those eggs? $. Want to participate in events every couple of weeks? $. Just buy a real Pokemon if that's your thing, or gameify walking with something less tedious.

They dont care about how much youve spent, or what you've already paid for. If you have an android, dont bother downloading.

cleaned_content: pokémon go is a captivating augmented reality game that seamlessly blends the virtual world of pokémon with our physical reality it encourages players to explore their surroundings discover new locations and interact with fellow trainers the game s innovative gameplay coupled with its nostalgic appeal has made it a global phenomenon while it may have some technical hiccups and in app purchases pokémon go remains a fun and engaging experience for fans of all ages
content: Pokémon Go is a captivating augmented reality game that seamlessly blends the virtual world of Pokémon with our physical reality. It encourages players to explore their surroundings, discover new locations, and interact with fellow trainers. The game's innovative gameplay, coupled with its nostalgic appeal, has made it a global phenomenon. While it may have some technical hiccups and in-app purchases, Pokémon Go remains a fun and engaging experience for fans of all ages.

cleaned_content: i ve been playing pokémon go since it was released in 2016 i am a level 43 player with just under 38 000 catches i was added to the pokémon go pass test group and i definitely have some feedback it does make the game more fun i ve been catching more daily pokémon the paid version does not seem worth it to me in either april or may also if you complete the pass the stardust is a meaningless reward for more advanced players have some rewards like egg incubators near the end
content: I've been playing pokémon GO since it was released in 2016. I am a level 43 player with just under 38,000 catches. I was added to the Pokémon Go Pass test group. And I definitely have some feedback. It does make the game more fun. I've been catching more daily Pokémon. The paid version does not seem worth it to me. In either April or May. Also, if you complete the pass, the Stardust is a meaningless reward. For more advanced players have some rewards like egg incubators near the end.

There were few high level players who helped on weekends but niantic ban them because they spoofed to do raids because they couldn't join us daily because they working during day time. + Remote raid pass are expensive & also shadow raids can't be done with remote pass. Just unban all.

(No customer service=1☆)

The core gameplay is simple and still somewhat engaging but gets stale quickly when you realize a lot of the fun is getting increasingly locked behind paywalls.

content: I love pokemon go. Been playing for years and its been improved overtime. I've never had to spend money in this game unless I wanted to. I've never run out of pokeballs or anything else i needed to progress. This game keeps me active and I'm lucky enough to work by a pokestop which keeps me fully stocked. If you aren't willing to walk/explore to find pokestops/gyms and new pokemon then this isn't the game for you. If you enjoy exploring then this is perfect for you.

cleaned_content: over all a good app the battle mechanics are simple but still engaging the catch rates are reasonable and level scaling is also there to prevent low level players with high power pokemon it can be challenging to play the game if you live in a rural or suburban area because you need to be able to spin pokestops to get most items and poke coins are unavailable other than through gyms of you don t spend any real money the game is still playable then but it puts you at a disadvantage
content: Over all a good app, the battle mechanics are simple but still engaging, the catch rates are reasonable, and level scaling is also there to prevent low level players with high power pokemon. It can be challenging to play the game if you live in a rural or suburban area because you need to be able to spin pokestops to get most items and poke coins are unavailable other than through gyms of you don't spend any real money. The game is still playable then, but it puts you at a disadvantage.

content: My favourite mobile game and top 5 pokemon game for me. All the different events are fun and I love party play and the new raid joining feature. Update: stability keeps getting worse, tired of losing remote passes :(

content: Terrible in game store practices as of recent. cleaned_content: after the update the character models for the player looks like they were downgraded the customization options you have aren t great either the faces look too similar to one another besides a single eyelash difference hair colors became more matte and less reflective of the lighting the abdominal area is lacking in customization which makes the player look like a noodle if they use don t increase the weight to max the update had great intentions but the execution of it was abysmal
content: After the update, the character models for the player looks like they were downgraded. The customization options you have aren't great either. The faces look too similar to one another besides a single eyelash difference. Hair colors became more matte and less reflective of the lighting. The abdominal area is lacking in customization, which makes the player look like a noodle if they use don't increase the weight to max. The update had great intentions, but the execution of it was abysmal.

cleaned_content: trickle down releases and wallet gouging prices this isn t the pokemon go that we knew in 2016 2020 critiques and criticisms are always abundant especially with one as popular as the pokemon franchise however a ton of updates quality of life improvements to be specific has given new life to this game post covid pokemon go was probably at its best where free2play elements were improved and encourage longer play time increased cost for raid passes shows where we are headed
content: Trickle down releases and wallet gouging prices. This isn't the pokemon go that we knew in 2016 - 2020. Critiques and criticisms are always abundant, especially with one as popular as the pokemon franchise. However a ton of updates, "quality of life" improvements to be specific, has given new life to this game. Post covid pokemon go was probably at its best where free2play elements were improved and encourage longer play time. Increased cost for raid passes shows where we are headed.

content: I started playing again after a long time and it's still just as fun as 2016. Unfortunately, however, I had to update this review with a lower rating. The visual environments update looks great and is a very welcome change, but the avatar update was very poorly executed one. Style items you may have paid for before now look bad, with objects clipping through each other and clothes seemingly no longer fitting. There's still a lack of a lot of basic customizations, such as facial hair.

cleaned_content: it s okay there are definitely some things they could do to make it a lot better 1 let people use masterballs on raid bosses without battling literally the whole point of a masterball 2 let people put legendary mythical and mega evolution pokémon in gyms and allow people to earn candy and energy by defeating them 3 more tag color options for sorting by type 4 adding trainer titles would be cool they have the medals for trainer types 5 let people trade legendaries mythics
content: It's...okay. There are definitely some things they could do to make it a lot better. 1. Let people use Masterballs on Raid Bosses WITHOUT battling, literally the whole point of a Masterball... 2. cleaned_content: pokemon go has changed my life for the better and i mean that with complete sincerity i used to live a very sedentary lifestyle which wreakes havoc on my body barely being able to walk for more than short distances go has let me gamify my physical activity giving me a way to enjoy getting active and after barely three months i m reliably walking upwards of 5 km a day the game has plenty of flaws but a game that has improved my life this much deserves the highest possible rating
content: Pokemon GO has changed my life for the better, and I mean that with complete sincerity. I used to live a very sedentary lifestyle which wreakes havoc on my body, barely being able to walk for more than short distances. GO has let me "gamify" my physical activity, giving me a way to enjoy getting active, and after barely three months I'm reliably walking upwards of 5 km a day. The game has plenty of flaws, but a game that has improved my life this much DESERVES the highest possible rating.

content: The game is alright. It's mostly the people behind the game that brought the score down. They don't listen to player feedback or fix major issues. For example, I've been having trouble defeating shadow legendary raids. My partner and I use the required number of gems, but the game doesn't register all of them, so the raid becomes impossible to defeat, AND the game doesn't refund the gems used. Player support may or may not compensate you with a raid pass (if it's Remy the bot then yes).

content: I've been playing since day 1. The state of the game is actually pretty great right now, & it's probably the best it's been yet. Yes, there can be improvements with the crashes, glitches, and bugs, but this isn't a constant thing at all, nothing is perfect. The biggest issue I have is the "Pay to Win" aspect. If you want to grind, you ultimately need to put money in the game. Yes, there should be more coin rewards as well. All the bad reviews do not justify how far this game has come whatsoever.

cleaned_content: great game that gets you out and about just wish it was a bit less grindy more depth there s also a conflict with streamlabs overlays that causes the game to become unresponsive if over draw is enabled would be great to get this fixed so people can stream more comfortably furthermore the grass shrub minigame prerequisite for ar catching needs to be eliminated entirely and heavy targeting assist added for ar mode too right now it s too hard to catch in this mode so most avoid playing
content: Great game that gets you out and about. Just wish it was a bit less grindy, more depth. There's also a conflict with Streamlabs overlays that causes the game to become unresponsive if over draw is enabled. Would be great to get this fixed so people can stream more comfortably. Furthermore, the grass shrub minigame prerequisite for AR catching needs to be eliminated entirely and heavy targeting assist added for AR mode too - right now it's too hard to catch in this mode, so most avoid playing 😞

content: With the recent TOS update I'm saddened to say that I cannot recommend PokemonGO to anyone now especially if you're a parent. One thing from TOS is the Arbitration clause that they have recently added. There's info to help you tell them you want to unequivocally opt out. If they actually let you opt out. Another addition to the update that's more concerning. In short Niantic Labs can use "mechanisms" that are used to detect cheating by going through YOUR DEVICE for unauthorized software.

cleaned_content: more focus needs to be invested in the key features rather than the events the whole point was to give people a more real life experience catching pokémon out in the wild but after you guys decided to remove the regular ar option people could no longer catch pokémon out in the wild and now we all have to settle for the regular background if we re going to stand a chance at catching any pokémon at all and why not a nice background for buddy pokemon instead of that pale green backdrop
content: More focus needs to be invested in the (key features) rather than the events. The whole point was to give people a more real-life experience catching pokémon out in the wild. But after you guys decided to remove the regular AR option, people could no longer catch pokémon out in the wild. And now we all have to settle for the regular background If we're going to stand a chance at catching any pokémon at all. And why not a nice background for buddy pokemon instead of that pale green backdrop?

content: Ball throwing bug has been fixed! Overall, PoGo is pretty good these days. Lots to do and lots of events. cleaned_content: what do you get when a company that doesn t know how to run a live service game buys the rights to make one for a very lucrative ip pokemon go i ve never played a game i have to actively try to enjoy aside from this one niantic continues to make and double down on changes that make things worse in order to really progress you have to spend money and the amount of glitches is inexcusable for such a massive ip i truly hate it here but at this point i ve wasted too much money to leave
content: What do you get when a company that doesn't know how to run a live service game buys the rights to make one for a very lucrative IP? Pokemon Go. I've never played a game I have to actively try to enjoy aside from this one. Niantic continues to make and double down on changes that make things worse, in order to really progress you have to spend money, and the amount of glitches is inexcusable for such a massive IP. I truly hate it here, but at this point I've wasted too much money to leave.

cleaned_content: i have edited this review to be more accurate let me simply say this despite much effort to improve the actual game itself beware buying any of the event tickets or raid day tickets often you are simply buying a sometimes undisclosed better chance at good things in the game it is often done in misleading ways the web store and app store have identically named tickets with separate rewards and the improvement to your luck is no guarantee of seeing any better rewards
content: I have edited this review to be more accurate. Let me simply say this: despite much effort to improve the actual game itself, beware buying any of the event tickets or raid day tickets. often you are simply buying a (sometimes undisclosed) better chance at good things in the game. It is often done in misleading ways (the Web store and app store have identically named tickets with separate rewards) and the improvement to your luck is no guarantee of seeing any better rewards.

cleaned_content: i like how this game gets you outside and exploring you can collect battle do routes compete in showcases raid team up with friends and really whatever else you feel like the game has some minor bugs that can be annoying at times but those aren t that common i ve gone to events and played for more than 6 hours with no issue at all overall it s a really fun game if you like collecting and exploring they ve added a lot of new content and features lately too fun stuff
content: I like how this game gets you outside and exploring. You can collect, battle, do routes, compete in showcases, raid, team up with friends, and really whatever else you feel like. The game has some minor bugs that can be annoying at times, but those aren't that common. I've gone to events and played for more than 6 hours with no issue at all. Overall, it's a really fun game if you like collecting and exploring. They've added a lot of new content and features lately, too. Fun stuff!

cleaned_content: in all aspects except functionality this game is perfect it integrates the core aspects of the pokemon franchise with an engaging mobile game concept that keeps you active that aside this game is sadly unplayable most instances i try to play the game i m forced to refresh the app or even log in again sometimes to no avail i wish the developers invested more time in refinining the playability of the game instead of obsessing over cosmetics and avatars
content: In all aspects except functionality, this game is perfect. It integrates the core aspects of the Pokemon franchise with an engaging mobile game concept that keeps you active. That aside, this game is sadly unplayable. Most instances I try to play the game I'm forced to refresh the app or even log in again, sometimes to no avail. I wish the developers invested more time in refinining the playability of the game instead of obsessing over cosmetics and avatars.

cleaned_content: a really cool app i like how it doesn t have to be a landmark that you have to go to in order to find pokemon there are pokemon everywhere i like the cool ar camera feature where you can put the pokemon in your room or in your space what i don t like however is how it keeps egging me on to try to find these pokestops while they might have good loot and stuff i don t want to be continually asked to go to one of these places still cool though
content: A really cool app. I like how it doesn't have to be a landmark that you have to go to in order to find Pokemon. There are Pokemon everywhere. I like the cool ar camera feature where you can put the Pokemon in your room or in your space. What I don't like however is how it keeps egging me on to try to find these pokestops. content: Despite the fun and engaging gameplay that rewards long walks and exercise, this bloated game hates Android phones. Mismanaged!

content: For the most part, this game is great. It gets me and my kids out walking when the weather is nice. The gameplay is engaging. My only issue is the trading system, where we have 3-star Pokémon that you can evolve with a trade, and they are no longer 3-star after the trade. It's stupid and makes no sense. Anything less than 3 stars isn't worth keeping because the attack, defense, and hp stats are too low.

content: I have played and loved this game since its release. Every player is disrespected with this greedy choice. Shame on you.

content: Really enjoyable when it works and frustrating when it doesn't. Lot's of things really hold this game back. 1. Lacking a Wonder Trade/Global Trade feature, you can only trade with someone next to you. 2. Raids take WAY too long to start (especially when you only wanna take it on yourself). There needs to be some sort of "start now" button. 3. Really stupid/asinine evolution requirements. 4. It would be cool if we could engage in wild battles. 5. A time limit needs to be set for pokemon in gyms.

cleaned_content: between redoing events that had issues and individual fixes from support on x i m glad they ve at least got decent response to when issues arise however 1 the game is still consistently glitchy these days from how much has been added causing support related issues in the first place and 2 they have definitely focused more on paid content leaving free players far behind and forcing at least some spending to experience full event content each of these cost a star on my review
content: Between redoing events that had issues and individual fixes from support on "X" I'm glad they've at least got decent response to when issues arise. However; 1. the game is still consistently glitchy these days from how much has been added, causing support related issues in the first place. And 2. they have definitely focused more on paid content, leaving free players far behind, and forcing at least some spending to experience full event content. Each of these cost a star on my review.

content: I have played almost religiously since the game first came out back in 2016. I love Pokemon and this game can be fun. Especially during big events like GO Fest and the generation Tour. Sometimes it feels like Niantic doesn't care too much about the best interest of the players or even making sure the game works properly with new additions. There are constant bugs and glitches, a definite increase in paid research tickets, and it sucks that shadow raids can only be done in person.

content: It plays well and was fun when it first came out. It feels a bit overwhelming trying to play as of late, especially considering that a lot of it feels like busy work. When it comes to Niantic games you've got Ingress with its "go to the place and do the thing," Pikmin Bloom with its "set it and and walk around" which feels more active, and then PokemonGO which feels like "stop every few steps to do a thing but also go to these places and do the thing." I WANT to love this game, but I don't.

I recommend skipping this game.

cleaned_content: makes my commute and all the walking i do for work feel like a reward in and of itself different pokemon appear at different places and times of year plus you get ingame rewards for walking longer distances partner pokemon add extra fun features the competitive aspect is simplified easy to pick up and intuitive some deeper mechanics require additional online research to understand but you ll only need that info if you re truly wild about competitive very casual friendly all in all
content: Makes my commute, and all the walking I do for work, feel like a reward in and of itself. Different Pokemon appear at different places and times of year, plus you get ingame rewards for walking longer distances. Partner Pokemon add extra fun features. The competitive aspect is simplified, easy to pick up, and intuitive. Some deeper mechanics require additional online research to understand, but you'll only need that info if you're truly WILD about competitive. Very casual friendly all in all.

cleaned_content: pokemon go is the one mobile game i really feel that i can endorse there is no pay to win paying only make a few things easier but far from all the real rewards comes from playing the actual game and encourage you to move around different places and spinning the pokestops and catching pokemons when you buy you can buy basic pokeballs some things that for 30 min gives extra dust or extra exp passes to battle more raids but nothing that jumps you 10 lvls or such
content: Pokemon go is the one mobile game I really feel that I can endorse. There is no pay to win. Paying only make a few things easier, but far from all. The real rewards comes from playing the actual game and encourage you to move around different places and spinning the pokestops and catching Pokemons. When you buy you can buy basic pokeballs, some things that for 30 min gives extra dust or extra exp. Passes to battle more raids. But nothing that jumps you 10 lvls or such

cleaned_content: to be honest it s a pretty bad game to start there s over 1000 pokémon in the franchise yet in the game you have to buy additional storage with irl money not gold coins you could earn doing missions or something then if your boxes get full suprise suprise you can t afford to get additional space for your beloved pokémon you will need to transfer the pokémon in a roundabout way rather than directly to the game desired if it wasn t for my beloved shinies i would gladly delete the game
content: To be honest, it's a pretty bad game. To start: There's over 1000 Pokémon in the franchise yet in the game you have to buy ADDITIONAL storage with irl money, not gold coins you could earn doing missions or something. Then if your boxes get full, suprise suprise, you can't afford to get additional space for your beloved Pokémon, you will need to transfer the Pokémon in a roundabout way, rather than directly to the game desired. If it wasn't for my beloved shinies, I would gladly delete the game!

I agree we can use daily incense to get free pokeballs, but they get used easily specially if you are on the hunt for some evolution pokemons. Curve throws waste lots of pokeballs and many pokemons waste so much pokeballs to catch. They want you to spend cash on this game to upgrade your bag and buy pokeballs. I had to discard useful items just to make space. Don't waste time on this game.

content: I have played Pokemon go since 2016, it has always been one of my favourite games, but there is an annoying bug in the game that caused me to loose a Hundo (Pokemon with perfect IV) I was in a regirock raid on the 6-7 Wednesday raid day, and I was lucky enough to come across a Hundo regirock from one of the raids, but when I went to catch it, my game crashed and by the time I had rebooted the game, the raids had reset, the cp was 1784 which is Hundo cp "Account name AAMemeist1og"

cleaned_content: it s relieving having a mobile game that doesn t have any ads in it just the game and no nonsense the monitization isn t bad i only find myself spending money if i m low on raid passes i wish we could purchase rare candies since i don t get nearly enough ralts spawns and the prices are great my only gripes are shadow raids being local only as sometimes i can t participate in them due to needing to cross a highway and trades being available only to people near you otherwise 10 10
content: It's relieving having a mobile game that doesn't have ANY ads in it, just the game and no nonsense. The monitization isn't bad, I only find myself spending money if I'm low on Raid Passes (I wish we could purchase Rare Candies, since I don't get nearly enough Ralts spawns) and the prices are great. My only gripes are Shadow Raids being local only, as sometimes I can't participate in them due to needing to cross a highway, and trades being available only to people near you. Otherwise, 10/10.

cleaned_content: the game is overall fun but is frequently held back from being great by bizarre developer decisions the avatars changes were extremely poor and resulted in ruining many paid outfits the player feedback has seemingly been ignored and the avatars still look awful compared to the old ones there is a large amount of resistance from the developer to allow online play even compared to their other titles like mh now this results in many raids and events being inaccessible to many players
content: The game is overall fun, but is frequently held back from being great by bizarre developer decisions. The avatars changes were extremely poor and resulted in ruining many paid outfits. The player feedback has seemingly been ignored and the avatars still look awful compared to the old ones. There is a large amount of resistance from the developer to allow online play, even compared to their other titles like MH Now. This results in many raids and events being inaccessible to many players.

There are also apps specially for raiding and getting friends like PokeGenie.

content: GoFest in LA was sad. Went on Day 1 (Friday). Security was very laxed, and didn't check our bags. Upon entering Rose Bowl from the main gate, we were greeted with a field that was mostly bare. "Habitat" decorations were underwhelming. Anyone else feel like Dynamax/ Gigantamax is phase 3? Shadow pokemon seemed like phase 2. Game feels re-skinned, and yet, a good amount of pokemon haven't been released in standard form. Legendary "fusion" overall feels old. Finally saying goodbye.-Day 1 Player

content: I was okay playing this game from time to time. However, due to the recent avatar controversy, I cannot in good conscious recommend this app. When the developer replaces distinct gender differences with androgynous, uncanny body proportions, and says the avatar can look more like you, it feels like a backhanded insult to consumers. It makes the player base feel bad, and makes Pokemon and Nintendo look worse. Until this virtue signaling is removed, I won't reinstall this game. No more DEI.

cleaned_content: i ve played since day 1 and will likely continue to play but i ve finally realized that the game penalizes long term players in favor of newer players the irony being that the newer players are going to rely on us veterans to help them level up and we re often the ones bringing in the new players but it seems every month niantic releases another event that s either a backhand to veteran players or inaccessible to veteran players when we complain sorry we intentionally mislead you
content: I've played since Day 1 and will likely continue to play. But I've finally realized that the game penalizes long-term players in favor of newer players. The irony being that the newer players are going to rely on us veterans to help them level up and we're often the ones bringing in the new players. But it seems every month Niantic releases another "event" that's either a backhand to veteran players or inaccessible to veteran players. When we complain? "Sorry, we intentionally mislead you."

content: Actually awful trying to play this game for fun. Half the time you waste pokeballs trying to catch a pokemon with a curve ball that's at the furthest range possible, but then you can't go get more balls because your bag is full, and you can't upgrade it without real money or guarding a gym, which you can't do if your faction doesn't have one near you. cleaned_content: the glory days of this game are far behind it every update for this game either introduces new bugs adds more monetization or even ruins things that were fine before like recently the appearance of the avatars for no reason even if the new designs were good they re still plagued with bugs such as clipping through clothes and parts of your body disappearing there is no excuse for such a profitable game to push out such an unpolished update like that
content: The glory days of this game are far behind it. Every update for this game either introduces new bugs, adds more monetization, or even ruins things that were fine before (like recently, the appearance of the avatars) for no reason. Even if the new designs were good, they're still plagued with bugs such as clipping through clothes and parts of your body disappearing. There is no excuse for such a profitable game to push out such an unpolished update like that.

I have a 2020 Moto G play and every key feature is being taken away.

The game has been deleted and hasn't been on in 6 plus months at this point.

cleaned_content: the game has bugs and wifi service issues it s possible to screw yourself up postponing your progress the game doesn t have any restart option so for the past few days i had to either wait or only battle pvp the worse thing is that i get disconnected by high ping or wifi the game is easy to fail with no pokeballs left if not used carefully in game making me lose all my months of progress the game was fun but please fix these bug issues and monitor your updates
content: The game has bugs and wifi service issues. It's possible to screw yourself up, postponing your progress. The game doesn't have any restart option, so for the past few days, I had to either wait or only battle/pvp, the worse thing is that I get disconnected by high ping or wifi. The game is easy to "fail"— with no pokeballs left, if not used carefully in-game, making me lose all my months of progress. The game was fun, but please fix these bug issues and monitor your updates.

cleaned_content: much more feature rich than the 2016 iteration there s actually tangible stuff to do now lol routes are a great excuse to go get some exercise most semi major areas and busier have a good distribution of gyms power spots and pokéstops if you play any games that can link with pokémon home this is the best way i ve found to get some top tier mons into those games with some caveats no mythicals etc minus a star raid catch rates can feel scammy and battling is still very barebones
content: Much more feature-rich than the 2016 iteration. There's actually tangible stuff to do now lol! Routes are a great excuse to go get some exercise. If you play any games that can link with Pokémon Home, this is the best way I've found to get some top tier Mons into those games (with some caveats, no mythicals, etc.) Minus a star, raid catch rates can feel scammy and battling is still very barebones.

cleaned_content: galaxy s24 yesterday s update wrecked the catch screen mechanics i ve always had native refresh rate on and loved it now every throw goes a mile behind the pokemon if i try really hard i can get a light throw that won t go far enough getting the right throw distance is nearly impossible i had to turn nrr off now i can actually catch pokemon again with choppy and slow graphics this needs to be fixed and the new avatars suck not because of woke whatever that means they just suck
content: Galaxy S24 Yesterday's update wrecked the catch screen mechanics. I've always had native refresh rate on and loved it. Now every throw goes a mile behind the pokemon. If I try really hard, I can get a light throw that won't go far *enough*. Getting the right throw distance is nearly impossible. I had to turn NRR off. Now I can actually catch pokemon again, with choppy and slow graphics. This needs to be fixed. And the new avatars suck. Not because of "woke", whatever that means. They just suck

I'd rather see uncommon and interesting pokemon than the same ones over and over

Overall its a fun and enjoyable game for both comfort and serious players but can have its drawbacks.

content: Edited from 5 stars to 1 because of the latest update (April 2024) The "update" to the trainer models was a poor choice, not only are their proportions strange and a little uncanny valley/horror esque, it's almost impossible to get my trainer even close to her appearance when we still had the old (and more visually appealing) trainer models. Honestly considering uninstalling, because I don't want to play something or spend money on a game where my avatar is ugly and not what I want to look at.

cleaned_content: 2022 the game is all over the place collecting is fun but battling isn t really it s a shame because raids gyms and leagues all hedge on it every new feature is monetized it s getting kinda predatory update 2025 lost another star the game has devolved into just another live service game with battle passes that i don t want events that don t improve the game and limited time items fueled by fomo not pleased i don t really play anymore
content: 2022 -The game is all over the place. Collecting is fun, but battling isn't, really. It's a shame, because raids, gyms, and leagues all hedge on it. Every new feature is monetized, it's getting kinda predatory. Update, 2025, lost another star - The game has devolved into just another live service game with battle passes that I don't want, events that don't improve the game, and limited time items fueled by FOMO. Not pleased. I don't really play anymore.

cleaned_content: i ve played this game for years off and on each time it s been better than before but for some reason as of the last few updates the game has become unbearably laggy it has reached a point where it is borderline unplayable i have adjusted all the in game settings and my phone settings but it s still extremely slow i ve burned so many pokeballs and resources just trying to throw them or attack but because of the lag you completely miss or your pokemon faints because it didn t register
content: I've played this game for years off and on. Each time it's been better than before, but for some reason as of the last few updates, the game has become unbearably laggy. It has reached a point where it is borderline unplayable. I have adjusted all the in game settings and my phone settings, but it's still extremely slow. I've burned so many pokeballs and resources just trying to throw them or attack, but because of the lag you completely miss, or your pokemon faints because it didn't register.

cleaned_content: there s just nothing here anymore legendaries are paywalled avatar customization has been made a joke god help you if you live anywhere but a densely populated city or near a park and trading online still isn t a feature several years in so good luck finding a pokemon that doesn t spawn in your country or climate there was a time i saw this as the definitive pokemon experience as tajiri envisioned it in the 90s but it s faded to just another mobile gacha cash grab
content: There's just nothing here anymore. Legendaries are paywalled, avatar customization has been made a joke, god help you if you live anywhere but a densely-populated city or near a park, and trading online still isn't a feature several years in, so good luck finding a Pokemon that doesn't spawn in your country or climate. There was a time I saw this as the definitive Pokemon experience, as Tajiri envisioned it in the 90s, but it's faded to just another mobile gacha cash grab.

content: Family Fun for all! We are a neurospicy household & I struggle to get the kids out the house as it feels safer & predictable to them @ home. Since they are obsessed with Pokémon I have been able to use this as an aid to get them out & about. We can walk a trail or put on some Incense & catch pokemon. It's not just a game that keeps your kids locked indoors - It wants you to all go out on a treasure hunt! Best game ever! I wish there was a device restricted to only play pokemon go - for kids!

content: Niantic makes WAY too much money for this app to be this buggy, poorly designed, and poorly understood. For example, a player would be reasonably certain that because of how the game hypes up purifying pokemon that it's beneficial, but it's the opposite. Or when you're rushing to complete things because your battery is running out or you have a time limit and the needless animation causes you to miss out. Or how everything was rightly speed gated, but then routes aren't. Fun, but frustrating

cleaned_content: pogo peaked during covid but has become more greed driven it can be fun if you re playing with friends but keep your expectations low niantic support is a joke there are many bugs and broken mechanics some of which have existed for years without fix don t expect compensation when a bug costs you a raid pass like i said can be fun but i recommend avoiding spending money or buying raid passes it s frustrating when a bug or broken mechanic costs you
content: PoGo peaked during Covid, but has become more greed driven. It can be fun if you're playing with friends, but keep your expectations low. Niantic support is a joke. There are many bugs and broken mechanics, some of which have existed for years without fix. Don't expect compensation when a bug costs you a raid pass. Like I said, can be fun but I recommend avoiding spending money or buying raid passes... It's frustrating when a bug or broken mechanic costs you.

I deeply wish the developer would either fix the player battles or stop pushing them so hard on the players.

cleaned_content: honest review i ve been playing pokémon go for a long time now and i think it s great it s a great game for pokémon lovers active people competitive people and pretty much everyone catch pokémon in the wild raid gyms to get legendary pokémon and so much more this game does involve walking driving around your area to get to battle rare pokémon and get to pokestops to get more items for new players i would also highly recommend getting the app campfire great game
content: *HONEST REVIEW* I've been playing Pokémon Go for a long time now,and I think it's great! It's a great game for Pokémon lovers, active people, competitive people, and pretty much everyone! Catch Pokémon in the wild, raid gyms to get legendary Pokémon, and so much more!!! This game does involve walking/driving around your area to get to battle rare Pokémon, and get to pokestops to get more items. For new players, I would also highly recommend getting the app Campfire. GREAT GAME!! 💩 😀

cleaned_content: i ve played pokémon go since 2016 and spent years of countless time and money on the game niantic banned my account without clear reason and my appeal was instantly rejected with no real explanation i play the game as it was intended to be played yet support refuses to review my case loyal players deserve better niantic you need to improve your customer support and give long time players a fair chance until then i can t recommend investing time or money into this game
content: I’ve played Pokémon GO since 2016 and spent years of countless time and money on the game. Niantic banned my account without clear reason, and my appeal was instantly rejected with no real explanation. I play the game as it was intended to be played, yet support refuses to review my case. Loyal players deserve better. Niantic, you need to improve your customer support and give long-time players a fair chance. Until then, I can’t recommend investing time or money into this game

Microtransactions for events you won't even get a good reward for, items that last only an hour, raid battles that are even more impossible with a fewer and fewer player count, and Pokémon that flee after one throw. content: Where to begin? I will say the game is fun. That being said, the community events are a JOKE! You have to raid a LOT to receive enough items to fuse Pokémon, but you can't get enough raid passes to raid enough to get them unless you want to spend $30 per player to even have a shot. There is a kids side to the game, but in no way does it make the game easier catching legendary Pokémon from the difficult raids. So your kid ends up heartbroken when it runs away.

cleaned_content: it s a really amazing game but there is almost no point in playing in rural areas as it is almost impossible to gather people for elite or shadow raids which often hold key pokemon that you need if you want to progress faster and to make things worse remote raids are copiously expensive to do which further destroys the experience for rural players overall the experience is great but i wouldn t recommend for rural players or those unwilling to pay extra cash just for a strong pokemon
content: It's a really amazing game, but there is almost no point in playing in rural areas as it is almost impossible to gather people for elite or shadow raids, which often hold key pokemon that you need if you want to progress faster. And to make things worse, remote raids are copiously expensive to do, which further destroys the experience for rural players. Overall, the experience is great, but I wouldn't recommend for rural players or those unwilling to pay extra cash just for a strong pokemon.

content: It was next to impossible to catch the Legendary Birds. Encounters Zapdos twice in as many days and Moltres. Got a chance to throw ONE single ball, followed by an immediate breakout, even with berries beforehand. It wasn't fair and there are also times where a low CP Pokémon breaks out of 15+ balls. The battling is outdated and poor. Tapping to build up just doesn't work. Pokémon is known for its battle system and this one is really low quality. 10+ years, no improvements, just regression.

cleaned_content: horrible this app constantly crashes also it s a terrible experience playing in the go battle league chronic issues with lagging and the algorithm they use to match you with opponents can be quite unfair at times your win percentage isn t really the best indicator of how good of a player you are finally if you try to report issues in the help section the chat bots don t do much to fix them but just give you canned answers this game really sucks i don t recommend it to anyone
content: Horrible. This app constantly crashes. Also, it's a terrible experience playing in the Go Battle League. Chronic issues with lagging and the algorithm they use to match you with opponents can be quite unfair at times. Your win percentage isn't really the best indicator of how good of a player you are. Finally, if you try to report issues in the Help section, the chat bots don't do much to fix them, but just give you canned answers. This game really sucks. I don't recommend it to anyone.
